metadata.title: CVE-2023-52594 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:ath9k: Fix potential array-index-out-of-bounds read in ath9k_htc_txstatus()Fix an array-index-out-of-bounds read in ath9k_htc_txstatus(). The bugoccurs when txs->cnt, data from a URB provided by a USB device, is biggerthan the size of the array txs->txstatus, which is HTC_MAX_TX_STATUS.WARN_ON() already checks it, but there is no bug handling code after thecheck. Make the function return if that is the case. Found by a modifiedversion of syzkaller. UBSAN: array-index-out-of-bounds in htc_drv_txrx.cindex 13 is out of range for type '__wmi_event_txstatus [12]' Call Trace:ath9k_htc_txstatus ath9k_wmi_event_tasklet tasklet_action_common__do_softirq irq_exit_rxu sysvec_apic_timer_interrupt

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
